column1: The document reveals Iran's strategic formation of the 'Axis of Resistance,' a coalition of various state and non-state actors united by the common goal of diminishing American influence and targeting the Israeli state.

column1: The report emphasizes that AI has become a pivotal element in Iran's regional strategy, equipping its allies with advanced tools for conducting sophisticated operations.

column1: 《The Impact of AI-Generated Art on Traditional Publishing and Readers》 AI-generated images can be used on book covers, a topic that has sparked much discussion in the traditional publishing industry.  One particular case involved an individual who published books online and used an AI-generated image for the cover, only to receive criticism from readers. This incident highlights the need for careful consideration of how to integrate new technology while meeting reader expectations.
column2: 《 AI 生圖對傳統出版業 kap 讀者 ê 影響 》 AI 生 ê 圖會當用 tī 冊 ê 封面，這層代誌 tī 傳統出版業引起真濟討論，尤其是有一个 tī 網路出版冊 ê 人，因為伊用 AI 做 ê 圖做封面，hō͘ 讀者嫌 kah 臭頭，這个例 hō͘ 咱看--著，咱 tō ài 好好仔想看覓按怎用新 ê 技術，koh 符合讀者 ê 期待。

column1: Publishers and authors who wish to use AI-generated art for book covers should first consider whether such images align with the book's story and whether readers would find them appealing. While AI can create beautiful images with its advanced technology, the key is to ensure they enhance the reader's experience rather than leading to disapproval.
column2: 出版業 kah 寫冊 ê 人若是欲用 AI 圖做封面，愛先想看覓 án-ne ê 圖 kap 冊 ê 故事有 tau-tah(鬥搭)--無，koh 愛想看覓讀者敢會佮意。雖罔用 AI 遮爾新 ê 技術會當做出真媠 ê 圖，毋過上要緊--ê 是愛 hō͘ 讀者感覺 khah 好，m̄ 是 hō͘ in 嫌。

column1: **Reader Expectations:** Traditional publishing places great emphasis on its relationship with readers. Any deviation from established practices, such as using AI-generated art for covers, may alienate some readers who have their own specific ideas and expectations regarding book covers.
column2: **讀者 ê 期待：**傳統出版業真注重 hām 讀者 ê 關係，若是有啥物做法 kap 本底無仝，親像用 AI 生圖做封面，凡勢會 hō͘ 一寡讀者無歡喜，因為 in 對冊 ê 封面有 in 家己 ê 想法 kap 期待。

column1: **Artistic Value:** Some readers and publishing professionals believe that using AI-generated art for covers undermines the value of art, as book covers traditionally have been created through human skill and creativity.
column2: **藝術 ê 價值：**有一寡讀者 kap 出版業 ê 人認為，用 AI 生圖做封面會共藝術 ê 價值破害--去，因為封面 ê 圖往過 lóng 是用人手 kah 創作力畫--出來 ê。

column1: **Authenticity and Emotion:** Book covers are crucial, as they evoke a sense of connection with the story and reflect its content. Some worry that AI-generated art lacks the same authenticity and emotional resonance as art created by human hands.
column2: **真情 kah 感動：**冊 ê 封面真要緊，伊會 hō͘ 讀者感覺 kap 故事有共鳴，mā 會 kā 故事 ê 內容表現--出來。有一寡人煩惱講，AI 生--出來 ê 圖無法度 chham 人畫--出來--ê 相像，有真情 kap 感動 ê 感覺。

column1: **Discussion with Readers:** Publishers and creators can engage in dialogue with readers to understand their perspectives on AI-generated art for book covers. This feedback will help determine whether their practices align with reader expectations and opinions.
column2: **Kap 讀者討論：**出版業 kap 創作者會當 chham 讀者討論，看 in 對 AI 生圖做封面有啥物看法，án-ne 就會當知影 in 家己 ê 做法有符合讀者 ê 期待 kap 想法--無。

column1: **Technological Limitations:** While AI can produce visually appealing images, it still lacks the ability to fully comprehend and express human emotions. Consequently, AI-generated covers may appear disconnected from the story's content.
column2: **技術 ê 限制：**AI 雖罔有法度畫真媠 ê 圖，毋 koh 伊 iáu 無法度完全了解 kap 表現人 ê 幼路心情，án-ne 做--出來 ê 封面佗檢采會 hō͘ 人感覺 chham 故事 ê 內容無 tau-tah(兜搭)。

column1: **Legal Issues:** As AI art technology becomes increasingly widespread, it inevitably raises questions about copyright, intellectual property, and the ownership of artistic creations.
column2: **法律 ê 問題：**因為 AI 畫圖 ê 技術愈來愈普遍，無的確會引起版權、智慧財產權 kap 藝術創作 ê 歸屬遮个問題。

column1: In this era, publishers and creators need to engage in meaningful discussions with readers and carefully consider the implications of their decisions. This approach will allow them to find a balance between embracing new technology and preserving the values of traditional publishing.
column2: 出版業 kap 創作者 tī 遮个時代，愛 kap 讀者好好仔討論，koh 愛好好仔想 in 做 ê 決定會有啥物影響，án-ne 才有法度 tī 應用新技術 kap 保留傳統出版業 ê 價值當中揣著平衡。

column1: This is my personal interest in understanding how AI will change all industries, our work, and our lives. The article, 'How is Japan's Publishing Industry Using AI?' column1: 1. AI in the Publishing Industry: Present and Future: - AI-driven transformation: AI is revolutionizing the publishing industry through automation, data analysis, and personalized reader experiences. - Cost reduction and efficiency improvement: AI tools can optimize workflows, manage inventory, and predict demand, effectively reducing costs and improving efficiency.

column1: - Digital transformation: AI plays a vital role in the digital transformation of the publishing industry, offering innovative services such as ebook recommendations, voice narration, and personalized, interactive content. - The future of AI in the publishing industry: AI is likely to become even more creative, capable of creating new genres and tailoring content to individual reader preferences, making reading more enjoyable.

column1: 2. column2: 2. AI kap 內容創作，新 ê 可能性: - AI 自動化生內容：seng-sêng(生成） AI工具有法度自動生文章、報告、甚至小說，會當 hō͘ 人力去做 khah 有創意 ê 工課。 - 編輯ê 創新: AI 編輯工具會用--得檢查語詞、文法、風格、kap 事實精確抑無，助贊編輯 ê 效率。

column1: - Ensuring content quality: AI can extract useful information from vast amounts of data, and generate coherent, consistent, and well-structured content, guaranteeing content quality. - Collaboration between writers and AI: AI can collaborate with writers to conduct research, develop story possibilities, and generate drafts, adding depth and diversity to their work.

column1: "Co-oppetetion: Cooperation and Competition, a Strategy for Mutual Victory"  Ha̍p-kēng (co-oppetetion) is a strategic concept where competing companies in the market collaborate to find a win-win situation. This is a blend of competition and cooperation, allowing businesses to share resources, knowledge, and expertise, fostering innovation, reducing costs, and increasing productivity. This approach is particularly common in industries where sharing technology, standards, or markets benefits participating companies, while simultaneously allowing them to maintain their competitive edge in other areas.
column2: 《 合競：合作 koh 競爭，鬥陣贏 ê 策略 》合競 (ha̍p-kēng)是一个策略性 ê 概念，市場--ni̍h ê 競爭公司會合作來揣双贏。這是競爭 kap 合作 ê 混合物，允準企業分享資源、知識 kap 專業知識，thang chhōa-sak(𤆬捒)創新、chún-chat(撙節)成本 kap 提懸生產力。這款法度 tī 共享技術、標準抑是市場弓大會利益公司ê 產業尤其四常，仝時陣 mā iáu-koh 會當 tī 其他領域維持 in ê 競爭優勢。

column1: Here are five examples of co-oppetetion: * Aviation: Airlines often sign co-oppetetion agreements to share resources such as airport gates or maintenance facilities. For instance, airlines can sign codeshare agreements to collaborate, offering passengers more destinations to choose from without having to operate their own flights.
column2: 遮有五个合競 ê事例：＊航空業：航空公司定定會簽合競協議來共享資源，親像機場登機門抑是維護設施。譬論講，航空公司會當簽共用班號協議來合作，hō͘ 乘客有 khah 濟 ê 所在 thang 去，m̄-koh m̄免家己營運航班。

column1: * Technology: Hardware and software companies often engage in co-oppetetion. For example, Apple and Samsung are rivals in the smartphone market, but they also collaborate; Samsung supplies components to Apple for manufacturing products. * Pharmaceuticals: Pfizer and BioNTech, two competing pharmaceutical companies, partnered to develop and distribute the COVID-19 vaccine, combining their resources to achieve a common goal.
column2: ＊科技業：硬體 kap 軟體公司常在參與合競。譬論講，Apple kap Samsung tī 巧手機仔市場--ni̍h 是競爭對手，m̄-koh 原仔會合作；Samsung 會賣部品hō͘ Apple 製造產品。＊製藥業：Pfizer kap BioNTech，這兩間競爭 ê 製藥公司，做伙合作開發 kap 發行 COVID-19 疫苗，結合 in ê 資源來致到共同目標。

column1: * Delivery Services: UPS and DHL, the two leading delivery companies, have an agreement where UPS delivers packages for DHL within the United States, helping DHL save costs and maintain its market share. * Automotive: Ford and GM, two of the largest car manufacturers, collaborate on developing new technologies, such as hybrid power systems and transmission designs, while still competing in car sales.
column2: ＊快遞服務：UPS kap DHL，這兩間快遞龍頭企業，有一項協議是 UPS tī 美國境內鬥相共DHL 運送包裹，助贊 DHL 撙節成本 kap 維持 tī 市場 ê 佔有率。＊汽車業：Ford kap GM，這兩間上大 ê 汽車製造商，做伙合作開發新技術，親像混合動力系統 kap mí-sióng (ミッション/ transmission）設計，仝時陣 tī 車 ê 銷售猶原是 leh 競爭。

column1: These examples illustrate how co-oppetetion can be a powerful strategy, enabling various industries to thrive and succeed.

column1: 《ChatGPT is Changing How We View Human Intelligence》 LLMs (Large Language Models), like ChatGPT, initially caused fear and a sense of existential threat among knowledge workers, whose identity is intertwined with intelligence. For over two millennia, humans have considered themselves superior to animals due to our intelligence and reasoning abilities, as articulated by philosophers like Aristotle and Anton Chekhov.
column2: 《 ChatGpt tng leh 改變咱對人類智力 ê 看法  》LLM（大言語 model），親像 ChatGPT 這款，頭一擺，會 hō͘ 智識工作者著驚，袂輸感受著生存 ê 威脅，因為 in ê 身份認同是 chham 智力 kat(結)做伙--ê。兩千冬外--lo͘h，人類攏 kā 家己準做較贏動物，因為咱有智力 kap 推論能力，親像哲學家 Aristotle kap Anton Chekhov 講--ê án-ne。

column1: As knowledge work flourished, our sense of worth and self-worth became increasingly tied to our intelligence and abilities. AI seems poised to encroach upon what we believed to be uniquely human domains like language and reasoning, threatening our self-concept. However, upon closer examination, we realize that ChatGPT can actually positively contribute to redefining and illuminating our understanding of 'intelligence.'
column2: Tī 智識工課 heng(興)--起來 ê 時，咱 ê 價值感 kap 自我價值，參咱 ê 智力、能力 koh 結愈牢--ah。AI 看--起來，煞袂輸欲來 thún-ta̍h(𧿬踏) 咱掠準是人類獨獨有 ê 領域，親像語言 kap 推論，這威脅著咱看待自我 ê 概念。不而過，kā 伊較詳細酙酌--落去，會看著講，ChatGPT事實會當正面來 hō͘ 咱kā「智力」重新定義 kap 拆明。

column1: In reality, 'intelligence' is a multifaceted construct composed of various cognitive processes, not a singular ability. Technological advancements have aided us in disentangling previously obscure psychological concepts, like the differentiation of lithium for treating bipolar disorder from other mental illnesses. Similarly, by recognizing ChatGPT's specialized ability for 'summarization', we can potentially remove this specific skill from our conception of human intelligence.
column2: 窮實「智力」是無法度定形 ê 認知過程來鬥做伙--ê，毋是孤一款能力。科技 tī 進前就 bat kā 咱鬥相共，開拆霧 sà-sà ê 心理概念，親像 Lí(鋰) kā 雙極性疾患ùi 其他精神疾病分別--出來。仝款道理，tī 認捌 ChatGPT 做「總結」iăn-jín ê 特定能力了後，咱會當 kā 「總結」 這項能力 ùi 咱對人類智力 ê 概念--ni̍h，kā徙走。

column1: ChatGPT excels at reformatting, reconstructing, and disseminating existing knowledge, but it lacks the capability to generate new knowledge. It excels at absorbing vast amounts of human knowledge, summarizing, organizing, and expressing it effectively. Hence, we can perceive ChatGPT as a 'mimicry machine' that can enhance cultural transmission and evolution, as cognitive scientist Alison Gopnik suggests. If we acknowledge 'summarization' as ChatGPT's core strength, knowledge workers can relinquish this skill from their self-identity.
column2: ChatGPT tī 重新格式化、重建，kap 傳遞現有知識，足 gâu，毋過若欲創造全新 ê智識，就無才調--ah。伊吸收大量 ê 人類智識，ka 總結 koh 組織、表達 ，是有厲害。所擺咱會使 kā ChatGPT 看做一粒「模仿 iăn-jín」，伊會當加強文化傳播 kap 演化，親像認知科學家 Alison Gopnik 講--ê。若準講咱認捌著「總結」是 ChatGPT ê 核心優勢，智識工作者 ê 自我認同--ni̍h 就會使免 koh 有這項。

column1: Many of our professional tasks often involve summarizing information from meetings, documents, books, codebases, etc. With ChatGPT's efficient summarization capabilities, we can free ourselves to focus on other aspects that AI currently cannot replicate. This includes our unique life experiences, emotional intelligence, guiding/editing summaries, and developing original ideas.
column2: 咱專業上做 ê 濟濟代誌，定定是 leh kā 資訊 ùi 會議、文件、冊、codebase等等總結--出來。有 ChatGPT 來較有效率 ka 總結，咱就鬆勢--ah，會用--得來注心 tī AI 猶無法度模仿 ê 其他代誌。包括咱獨特 ê 人生經驗、情緒智力、指導/編輯 總結，iah-sī 發展原創 ê 想法。

column1: Redefining intelligence by acknowledging AI's strengths allows us to maintain our sense of human uniqueness. As anthropologist Joe Henrich argues, we adapt our self-concept based on the technological and cultural environment we inhabit. Just as humans have historically adapted to 'technology' by learning new cultures for survival, we can readjust our psyche in the age of AI. We won't be replaced; instead, we'll be the managers and orchestrators of AI's summarization capabilities, leading to richer life goals.
column2: Kā AI ê 能力掠外看待來 koh 再定義智力，會當 hō͘ 咱維持人類獨特性 ê 感覺。親像人類學家 Joe Henrich 所講，咱會 tòe 咱存在 ê 科技 kap 文化環境，來調整自我概念。若像往過人類經由學習新 ê 文化 適應「科技」來生存，咱會當 tī AI ê 時代，koh 來調整咱 ê 心理。咱 m̄-nā bē 去 hō͘ 替換，顛倒咱會是AI 總結能力 ê 管理員 kap 安排者，按呢來致到 khah 豐沛 ê 人生目標。

column1: AI like ChatGPT is not here to replace us. While some summarization-based jobs may be disrupted, it also creates opportunities for humans to utilize their unique strengths. We can leverage this technology, collaborating with AI to create a beautiful, rich, and positive cultural evolution, without fixating on unfounded risks and shortcomings.
column2: 親像 ChatGPT 這款 ê AI，毋是來替換--咱 ê。雖罔一寡做概要 ê 飯碗凡勢會去 hō͘ 創亂--去，不而過，伊 mā 會創造機會 hō͘ 人 thang 發揮獨特 ê 人 ê 優勢。咱會當利用這項科技，參 AI 合作，來成造美麗、豐沛 kap 正面 ê 文化演化，毋免 ti-leh 執著無的確个風險 kap 欠點。

column1: The Earth's water cycle refers to the path that water takes as it moves around our planet and the ways it changes form. This process is very important because it affects the weather, climate, and life of all living things.
column2: 地球水循環，講--ê，tō 是水 tī 咱地球四界走傱 ê 路線，chham 伊變化 ê 方式。這个過程誠要緊，因為伊會影響著天氣、氣候、kap 所有生物 ê 性命。

column1: First, water in the oceans, lakes, rivers, and on land is heated by the sun and turns into water vapor, which is very light and rises up. This process is called "evaporation."
column2: 第一站，水 tī 海、湖、河、kap 塗跤，hō͘ 日頭曝 kah燒，就成做水氣，輕輕輕，chhèng(衝)--起來。這个過程號做「蒸發」。

column1: Plants also contribute to water evaporation. The water that their roots absorb is released into the air through their leaves, a process called "transpiration."
column2: 植物 mā 會鬥相共水蒸發，in ùi 植物 ê根suh(欶)--tio̍h ê 水，會 tùi 葉仔 tòe 氣空走--chhut-lâi，這號做「蒸散」。

column1: Second, as water vapor rises higher in the air, the temperature gets colder and colder. The water vapor then begins to condense, turning into tiny water droplets or ice crystals. These come together to form clouds.
column2: 第二站，水氣 tī 空氣--ni̍h愈來愈懸，溫度 tō 愈來愈低，水蒸氣 chŏaⁿ(就按呢)開始堅--起來，成做細粒水珠仔，抑是堅做冰晶，遮个鬥做伙，就成做雲--lo͘h。

column1: Third, the water droplets and ice crystals in the clouds grow bigger and bigger.  When the clouds can no longer hold their weight, the water droplets fall down as rain. If they freeze, they become snow or hail.
column2: 第三站，水珠kap 冰晶 tī 雲內底，會愈來愈大粒，雲 chŏaⁿ 無法度chih-chài(接載)這款重，水滴 to̍h 開始落--落來，變做雨。若堅做冰晶--ê，就成做雪抑是雹--ah。

column1: Fourth, some of the rain falls directly into the ocean, while some flows into rivers and lakes, and then from the rivers back into the ocean. Water that falls on the ground seeps into the soil and becomes groundwater, or it flows directly into streams, rivers, and lakes. Plants also absorb groundwater to help them grow.
column2: 第四站，落--落來 ê 雨水，有一部份會直接落 tī 海--ni̍h，另外有一寡會流入去河、湖，koh ùi 河--ni̍h，流轉去海--ni̍h。落 tī塗跤 ê 水，會sia̍p(洩)--入去土--ni̍h，變做地下水，抑是直接流--入去溪仔、河、湖。植物 ê 根 mā 會欶地下水，來助贊 in 生長。

column1: These four stages cycle over and over again.  Moreover, even though these stages take place in different locations, they still affect each other.
column2: 這四站，會一擺 koh 一擺直直循環--落去，m̄-nā án-ne，這四个站 to̍h 準講是無仝款 ê 所在，原仔是會互相影響。

column1: To learn more about the Earth's water cycle, please read the second part.
column2: 欲知影 khah 濟地球水循環 ê 代誌，請看第二部份。

column1: Now in the second part, let's talk about the importance of the Earth's water cycle in more detail.
column2: 紲--落來第二葩，咱來 kā 地球水循環 ê 重要性 koh 講予較詳細--leh。

column1: The Earth's water cycle is not just a romantic tale of water traveling around. It's actually the foundation of life on Earth.
column2: 地球水循環 m̄-nā 是水 leh 四界𨑨迌 ê 浪漫故事 niā-niā，這正正是地球性命 ê 地基石。

column1: You see, the water cycle helps regulate the Earth's temperature. Seawater absorbs heat from the sun and then releases it during evaporation, preventing the Earth's climate from becoming too hot or too cold.
column2: 咱來看，水循環會 kā 地球溫度控制 hō͘ 妥當，海水會吸日頭 ê 燒熱，koh tī 蒸發 ê 時陣，kā 熱徙--走，地球 ê 氣候才袂變 kah 過頭熱，抑是過頭寒。

column1: The water cycle also helps transport various minerals and nutrients around the Earth, making life possible. Rainwater carries minerals washed from rocks and soil into the ocean, which are then carried to other places by ocean currents. Plants absorb these minerals from the soil, and animals eat plants. This is how the water cycle benefits all living things.
column2: 水循環 mā 會 kā 各種礦物質 kap 營養分 tī 地球四界徙來徙去，hō͘ 生物 ē-tàng 生長。雨水會 kā ùi 岩石 kap 塗跤洗--出來 ê 礦物質徙--去海--ni̍h，koh 綴海流 去 kah 其它所在。植物 ùi 塗跤欶著遮个礦物質，動物 koh食植物，水循環 chŏaⁿ 利益所有性命。

column1: However, human activities have affected the water cycle. For instance, when forests are cut down, the soil can't retain water, leading to landslides. Rivers also become shallower, creating problems with water resources. Furthermore, industrial wastewater and pesticides pollute water sources, harming both wildlife and human health.
column2: 毋過，人類 ê 活動已經影響著水循環，譬論講，森林 hông chhò(剉)剉--去，塗--ni̍h ê 水分無法度保存，to̍h 會厚塗石流，河川 mā 會變較淺，煞水源有問題。koh 有，工業廢水 kap 農藥，會 kā 水源汙染，敗害生物 kap 人 ê 健康。

column1: We must take good care of the Earth's water cycle so that all living things can thrive on this beautiful planet forever.
column2: 咱愛好好仔看顧地球水循環，才thang hō͘ 所有生物 ē-tàng 永遠 tī 這个水噹噹 ê 地球頂懸，生活 kah 四序四序。

column1: To learn how to protect the Earth's water cycle, let's look at the third part.
column2: 欲知影按怎看顧地球水循環，咱來看第三葩。

column1: In the third part, let's think about how to properly protect the Earth's water cycle.
column2: 第三葩，咱來想--看覓，按怎 thang 好好仔保護地球水循環。

column1: Protecting the water cycle is not just the responsibility of governments and experts. We all have a responsibility. We can help by being more mindful in our daily lives.
column2: 保護水循環，m̄ 是政府 hām 專家 ê 代誌 niā-niā，咱逐家 lóng 有責任。咱 ē-tàng 生活內底較細膩--leh，來鬥相共。

column1: For example, conserve water. We should try to use less water when showering, washing clothes, and washing dishes. We can also collect unused water to water plants or clean floors.
column2: 譬論講，省水。洗身軀、洗衫、洗碗盤，lóng 愛盡量省水，無愛ê 水，mā ē-tàng khiām(儉)--起來沃花，抑是用來洗塗跤。

column1: Next, plant trees. Trees help retain water in the soil, prevent soil erosion, and aid the water cycle. So, we can plant trees around our neighborhoods or participate in tree-planting events to make the Earth greener.
column2: koh 來，種樹仔。樹仔會當幫贊水分留 tī 塗跤，防止水土流失，幫贊水循環。所擺，咱 ē-tàng tiàm 厝邊頭尾，抑是參加活動來四界種樹仔，hō 地球青青青。

column1: Also, reduce waste, especially plastic waste. It's difficult for plastic to decompose in nature, and it contaminates water sources. We can carry reusable bags and cups and avoid using disposable plastic products.
column2: koh 有，mā 愛減少 pùn-sò(糞埽)，尤其是塑膠糞埽，塑膠tī 自然界足oh(僫)分解，koh 會污染水源。咱 ē-tàng 家己chah(紮)環保袋仔、環保杯仔，莫用一次性 ê 塑膠製品。

column1: Lastly, be mindful of wastewater discharge. Don't pour water containing chemicals into drains because it pollutes rivers and oceans, harming the water cycle and the lives of creatures.
column2: 上尾，mā 愛要意生活廢水 ê 排放，mài kā有帶化學藥劑 ê 水 倒--入去水溝仔，因為遮个會污染河溪kap 海洋，敗害水循環 kap 生物 ê 性命。

column1: The Earth's water cycle is our shared responsibility. If we all care and work together, we can certainly protect the Earth's environment better.
column2: 地球水循環，是咱共同 ê 責任，逐家若是 lóng 有心，做伙鬥相共，定著 ē-tàng kā 地球環境保護 hō͘ khah 好。

column1: With AI technology rapidly advancing worldwide, Nissin keenly recognized this unstoppable emerging force. To seize the tremendous business opportunities presented by AI, Nissin decided to actively integrate generative AI across all facets of the company, from R&D to sales and marketing, leaving no stone unturned.
column2: AI 技術 tī 全世界快速發展，Nissin 清楚認捌著這港擋袂牢 ê 新勢力。為著欲 kā AI 𤆬--來  ê 商業機會掠 hō͘ 牢，Nissin 決定 tī 公司內底，ùi 研發、銷售 kap 行銷，lóng-chóng 積極 kā 生成 AI 用--落去。

column1: Building a Dedicated AI Environment with Assured Security
column2: 起造一个專用 ê AI 環境

column1: Nissin joined forces with Microsoft Azure to construct the specialized AI platform "NISSIN AI-chat." This AI environment is not only secure and reliable but also ensures the confidentiality of company information, allowing Nissin to leverage AI technology with peace of mind. Stringent management regulations and usage guidelines were also established, with the classic cartoon character "Chikin Ramen" educating employees and reminding them of security and compliance considerations when using AI.
column2: Nissin kap Microsoft Azure 合作，起造一个專用ê AI 平台「NISSIN AI-chat」。這个 AI 環境 m̄-nā 安全可靠，mā 會當確保公司資訊 ê 秘密性，hō͘ Nissin 安心來用 AI 技術。In mā 設定嚴格 ê 管理規範 kap 使用準則，用經典 a-ní-me(anime=動畫) 角色「雞仔Ramen」來 kā 員工教育，提醒 in 用 AI ê 時陣，愛注重安全 kap 規範。

column1: Embracing the AI Era Through Comprehensive Training
column2: 全面來訓練，kā AI 時代攬 hō͘ 牢

column1: To enable employees to quickly get up to speed with AI technology, Nissin has devised comprehensive training programs ranging from beginner to advanced levels. Whether new or experienced, everyone can progressively master the use of AI tools and become one with them. Nissin also shares successful AI implementation cases across departments, encouraging company-wide embrace of the AI era.
column2: 為著欲 hō͘ 員工 ē-tàng 緊把握 AI 技術，Nissin 設計一套完整 ê 訓練計畫，ùi 初級到進階 lóng 有。無論是菜鳥 iah-sī 熟手，逐家 lóng ē-tàng 勻勻仔學會曉用 AI 工具，kap AI kap(合)做陣。Nissin mā tī 各部門分享成功 ê AI 應用案例，鼓勵全公司 lóng 愛 kā AI 時代攬 hō͘ 牢。

column1: Innovative Service Models Powered by AI's Prowess
column2: 借 AI ê 力量，來 kā 服務模式創新

column1: Today, AI's presence is ubiquitous within Nissin. From the sales department automating document and report generation to the marketing team conducting market analysis, the R&D center developing new products, and the customer service center providing personalized services, AI lends its might to Nissin's endeavors at every turn.
column2: 這馬，AI tī Nissin 內底，四界 lóng 看會著。ùi 銷售部門用 AI 自動生成文件 kap 報告，到行銷團隊用 AI 做市場分析，研發中心用 AI 開發新產品，kap 客服中心用 AI 提供客製化服務，AI tī Nissin ê 各種工課來回--ni̍h，lóng-chóng 有 leh 鬥跤手。

column1: Soaring Efficiency and Stellar Performance
column2: 效率衝懸，表現影目

column1: Since introducing AI, Nissin has witnessed a remarkable surge in operational efficiency, with projected annual cost savings amounting to thousands of hours in labor. Decision-making and product development have also been accelerated, allowing the company to seize market opportunities promptly. More importantly, AI has enabled Nissin to deliver superior, more personalized customer service, significantly boosting customer satisfaction and loyalty.
column2: Ùi 起頭用 AI 了後，Nissin ê 營運效率就顯明衝懸--起來，按算一冬 ē-tàng kā 幾若千點鐘 ê 人工成本省--落來。決策 kap 產品開發 ê 速度 mā 有較緊，hō͘ 公司 ē-tàng 隨時 kā市場機會掠牢--leh。Khah 要緊--ê 是，AI hō Nissin ē-tàng 提供 khah 讚、khah 個人化 ê 客戶服務，大碼提升客戶 ê 滿意度 kap 忠誠度。

column1: Looking ahead, AI will become even more deeply integrated into Nissin's various business systems, enabling broader automation. Advanced AI capabilities such as image generation and voice recognition are on the horizon. With a future-focused vision, Nissin will continually refine its AI capabilities, build an innovative corporate culture centered around AI, and continue creating greater value for its customers.
column2: 向前看，AI 會 thòaⁿ(湠) koh-khah 深，來 kā Nissin ê 各款商業系統kap(合)--做伙，致到 khah 大範圍 ê 自動化。親像影像生成 kap 語音辨識遮个進階 AI 功能，mā tī leh 發展--lo̍h。Nissin 以對焦未來 ê 願景，會繼續 kā AI 能力磨 hō͘ 愈利，起造一个用 AI 做中柱 ê 創新企業文化，繼續為 in ê 客戶創造 khah 大 ê 價值。

column1: AI社会では｢文系･理系｣の融合こそ喫緊の課題
column2: AI 社會，文組 kap 理組 ê 融合，才是上要緊 ê 問題--ah。

column1: AIの急速な進歩に伴い、現代社会では文系と理系の融合が喫緊の課題となっています。
column2: AI 發展 kah 足緊，現代社會內底，文組 kap 理組著愛 sio-chia̍h-àⁿ(相食向=融合），這已經是上要緊 ê 問題--ah。

column1: この状況下で、大学教育のあり方を抜本的に見直す必要性が高まっています。
column2: 款狀況之下，咱需要 kā 大學教育 ê 方式好好仔 koh 再思考--一下。

column1: 東京大学教授で人工知能研究の第一人者である松尾豊氏は、専門教育の後に教養教育を学ぶべきだと提言しています。
column2: 東京大學教授，mā 是 AI 研究上 gâu ê 人，松尾豊，伊提議講，應該愛先學專門 ê 智識，了後才 koh 來學通識。

column1: 松尾氏は、日本の大学では1、2年生で教養を学ぶカリキュラムが主流ですが、これでは学問的な深みに欠けると指摘します。
column2: 松尾教授認為講，日本大學大部分 lóng 是 1、2 年仔先學通識，m̄-koh án-ne 學問 ê 深度 to̍h 會無夠。

column1: 社会で真に活躍するためには、専門知識を身につけた後に、異なる分野や考え方について学ぶことが不可欠だと述べています。
column2: 伊認為講，欲 tī 社會真正會當活動、走跳，應該愛先 kā 專門 ê 智識先學 hō͘ 好，了後才 koh 來學無仝領域 ê 代誌 kap 無仝款 ê 想法，按呢才會用--得。

column1: 特にリーダーを目指す人にとって、教養教育は必須だと力説しました。
column2: 伊 koh 特別強調講，若是欲做領導者，通識 to̍h 是百面愛學--ê。

column1: また、松尾氏は文系・理系の分断についても問題提起しています。
column2: 另外，松尾教授 mā 講著文組 kap 理組分--開 ê 問題。

column1: 理系科目は概念のネットワークが密接に連結しているため、一つでもつまずくと先に進めなくなる傾向があります。
column2: 伊認為講，理組 ê 科目，概念 lóng 互相牽連，若是有一項袂曉，就 khah oh(僫)學落去。

column1: 一方、文系科目は個別の知識の塊であるため、部分的に理解できなくても全体への影響は少ないとのこと。
column2: M̄-koh，文組 ê 科目，大部分 lóng 是單獨 ê 智識 ，就準講有一部份無了解，mā 袂去 kā 規个影響--著。

column1: この違いから、理系の学生は万能感を持ちがちで社会で活躍しづらく、
column2: 因為這款無仝，理組 ê 學生 khah 會感覺家己啥物 lóng 會曉，煞 就按呢 tī 社會較歹活動。

column1: 文系の学生は早くから協調性の必要性を理解できる強みがあると分析しています。
column2: 文組 ê 學生，因為較早 to̍h 知影愛 kap 人鬥相thīn(伨)，這 to̍h 是 in ê 利點。

column1: しかし、松尾氏は文系と理系の両方が等しく重要であると強調しています。
column2: M̄-koh，松尾教授 mā 強調講，文組 kap 理組 lóng 平平要緊。

column1: AIの発展により、技術的な側面だけでなく、倫理的・社会的な影響を考慮することが求められています。
column2: AI 發展了後，毋是干焦技術方面 ê 問題，倫理 kap 社會 ê 影響，mā 愛考慮--入去。

column1: この複雑な問題に取り組むには、文系と理系の知識を融合させることが不可欠です。
column2: 欲解決遮爾複雜 ê 問題，文組 kap 理組 ê 智識 to̍h 愛相合(kap)--起來。

column1: 文系の学生は社会科学や人文科学の知見を活かし、技術がもたらす社会的な影響を予測・分析することができます。
column2: 文組 ê 學生 ē-tàng 用社會科學 kap 人文科學 ê 智識，來預測 kap 分析技術對社會 ê 影響。

column1: 一方、理系の学生は技術的な側面から、AIの可能性と限界を理解し、適切な開発・活用方法を提案できます。
column2: 理組 ê 學生，ē-tàng ùi 技術 ê 角度，來了解 AI ê 可能性 kap 限制，才 koh 來提議應該 án-chóaⁿ 開發 kap 用 AI。

column1: 教育システムを改善し、文系の学生でも理系の知識を身につけやすくすること、理系の学生も自らの弱点を理解し協調性を養うことが、AI時代を生き抜く人材育成には不可欠だと松尾氏は訴えています。
column2: 松尾教授認為講，欲 tī AI 時代培養 ē-tàng 生存 ê 人才，咱需要 kā 教育系統改 hō͘ khah 四序，hō͘ 文組 ê 學生 mā khah 順序學會著理組 ê 智識，hō͘ 理組 ê 學生 mā 會當了解家己 ê 欠點，mā 來學習 chham 人合作、鬥相thīn(伨)。

column1: 文系・理系の垣根を越えた学際的な教育が、これからの社会で求められる複合的な問題解決能力を育成するカギとなるでしょう。
column2: 按呢，Kā 文組 kap 理組 ê 界線 hāⁿ(迒) ho͘ 過，來做 hāⁿ(迒)學科 ê 合作 kap 學習，才會當培養 tī 未來社會有才調會當解決各種複雜問題 ê 人才。

column1: 加えて、大学教員自身が実社会を知らないケースが多いことも問題視されました。
column2: 另外，訪問者 堀內勉 mā 講著，大學老師本身無 tī 社會食頭路，無遐了解社會狀況。

column1: 学問と社会の関係性を見直し、学者もビジネスパーソンも共に学び合える場が必要だと、インタビュアーの堀内勉氏は指摘しています。
column2: 伊認為講，咱需要重新思考學問 kap 社會 ê 關係，hō͘ 學者 kap 商業人士 ē-tàng tī 仝一个所在鬥陣學習。

column1: 教員自身が社会の第一線で活躍する人々と交流することで、教育内容をアップデートし、より実践的な知識を学生に提供できるはずです。
column2: 老師若是 kap 社會上厲害 ê 人鬥陣交流，to̍h ē-tàng kā 教育 ê 內容更新，koh kā 較實用 ê 智識教 hō͘ 學生。

column1: 松尾氏は教養を「リーダーが意思決定するために必要なもの」と定義し、実践知に近いものだと述べます。
column2: 松尾教授 kā 通識解說做「領導者欲做決定 ê 時，需要 ê 代誌」，伊認為通識 kap 實務經驗 khah 倚。

column1: 歴史や他者の経験から学ぶことで物事の見方を広げ、正しい意思決定につなげることが重要だと強調しています。
column2: 伊強調講，ùi 歷史 kap 別人 ê 經驗來學習，ē-tàng hō͘ 咱看代誌 ê 角度 khah 曠闊，才有才調落正確 ê 決定。

column1: 特に失敗が許されないような政治や経営の意思決定には、教養が不可欠だと述べました。
column2: 伊 koh 特別講著，tī 政治 kap 經營方面，落 ê 決定若是失敗，後果 to̍h 會誠嚴重，所以通識 to̍h 更加要緊。

column1: リーダーには、専門知識だけでなく、幅広い教養に基づく俯瞰的な視野が求められるのです。
column2: 領導者 m̄-nā to̍h 愛有專門智識，mā 愛有 ùi 各種通識學--來 ê 宏觀視野才會使。

column1: AI時代に求められる人材を育成するには、文系･理系の垣根を越えた教養教育の見直しが急務です。
column2: 欲 tī AI 時代培養咱欲愛 ê 人才，咱 to̍h 愛緊緊 koh 再思考文組 kap 理組 ê 通識教育。

column1: 専門教育の後に異分野の知識を学び、学問と社会の関係性を理解することが、これからのリーダーには求められています。

column2: 我 tn̄g(搪)著濟濟僥疑。Stanford 事實上直直 leh 追蹤我 ê 預測。In 開一个國際會議來講論我 ê 預測。

column1: And hundreds of AI scientists came from around the world. And they agreed that it would happen. We would achieve AGI, but not within 30 years.
column2: 幾若百个 AI 科學家 ùi 全世界來。In lóng 同意講這會發生，咱會致到 AGI，m̄-koh 毋是 30 冬內。

column1: The estimate was 100 years. And I've talked actually to some of the people who were there who said 100 years then and they're basically agreeing it's going to happen very soon.
column2: In 估愛 100 冬。我事實上有 kap 幾若个有去遐 ê 人講話，in 彼陣講愛 100 冬，這馬 in 差不多 lóng 贊同講，這層代誌足緊就會發生--a h。

column1: Musk says it's going to happen in two years. It's not an unreasonable position. Other people saying three or four years, I'm sticking with five years.
column2: Musk 講兩冬內會發生。這毋是無道理。其他有人講三、四冬，我猶是堅持五冬。

column1: But it could happen soon. But everybody agrees now, AGI is very soon.
column2: 不而過，無的確 khah 緊就會發生。但是，這馬逐家 lóng 贊同，AGI 足緊--ah。

column1: So I have another book coming out, "The Singularity is Nearer." (Laughter) And I've got about 50 graphs in there. I can't explain it right now, but if you talk to me later, I can explain these charts, but it basically shows that artificial intelligence is going to take over everything.
column2: 我 koh 有一本冊欲出版--ah，號做《奇點 khah 近--ah》。 (笑聲) 內底有大約 50 張圖表。我這馬無法度 kā 解說，m̄-koh 假使你較停仔 koh 來 kap 我講，我會當 kā 遮个圖表解說 hō͘ 你聽，不而過簡單講，伊基本上是顯示講 AI 欲 kā 萬項代誌接手--去。

column1: The amount of -- (Laughter) The amount of money that we make right now is ten times greater in constant dollars than it was 100 years ago. We were very, very poor 100 years ago, there was no government programs.
column2: 咱這馬趁… (笑聲) 咱這馬趁 ê 錢，用固定 ê 錢來算，比 100 冬前 khah 濟 10 倍。100 冬前，咱有影有夠散赤，政府 mā 無啥物計畫。

column1: So we're much richer than we were then. And the movement, not only of computation, but every single technology, is done by creating, taking the latest thing we've created and making the next one.
column2: 所以，咱這馬較彼陣加足好額。而且，毋是干焦電腦計算能力，所有 ê 科技，lóng 是用咱上尾創造 ê 物件，來做後一个物件。咱用上尾 ê chhi̍p(chip)，來做後一粒 chhi̍p。

column1: We take the latest chip and we use that to create the next one. We have greater wealth, as I said, that leads to better education, leads to better doctors, leads to healthy people, leads to more global wealth.
column2: 咱提上尾 粒 chhi̍p(chip)，koh 用彼來生後一粒。我講--過，咱有較濟財產，就會當 hō͘ 教育 khah 好，醫生 khah gâu，人 khah 康健，全球財富 khah 濟。

column1: All of these things work together. AI supercharges everything.
column2: 遮个物件 lóng 鬥陣振動。AI 會 kā 所有代誌大崁加強。

column1: So I could talk about each thing as being actually revolutionized. I think the most interesting thing is actually medicine.
column2: 所以，我會使講逐項物件窮實 lóng 會 ho͘ 革命--去。我想講上趣味 ê 代誌是醫學。

column1: There are a lot of people who are experts in AI who are against what's happening, and they're very nervous about it, and they think it's going to wipe us out.
column2: 濟濟是 AI 專家 ê 人反對 tng leh 發生 ê 代誌，in 足煩惱，想講 AI 會 kā 咱 piaⁿ(抨)--hìⁿ-sak。

column1: But people tend to get diseases which are threatening to them. And what's going to happen? People are going to get diseases and AI is going to come up with a cure, very soon, which will lead to a great deal of appreciation.
column2: 不過，人定定會著著威脅--in ê 病。Án-ne 會按怎？人會著病，AI 會揣著藥方，按呢人 to̍h 會 (túi AI) 足感恩。

column1: People say that AI is not creative. It's very creative. You can actually put together possibilities that might work.
column2: 有人講 AI 無創意，m̄-koh 伊是誠有創意。事實上你會當 kā 凡勢有效 ê 可能性鬥 hō͘ 做伙(來看覓)。

column1: For example, Moderna was trying to create their COVID vaccine. They actually put together a list of different mRNA sequences. Now, what would we do in the past?
column2: 譬論講，Moderna 彼陣 leh 試欲創 in ê COVID 疫苗。In 事實上是 kā 幾若款無仝 mRNA 序列鬥--起來。A h，咱往過會按怎做？

column1: Someone would come in and say, "OK, there's several billion. Let's try this one." Or maybe they'd pick three. You can't ... do a clinical test on billions of different possibilities.
column2: 有人會來講：「好--lah，遮有幾若十億項，咱來試這款。」或者是 in 無定著會揀三款。(Koh 講) 你無法度…tī 幾若十億無仝 ê 可能性--ni̍h 做臨床試驗。

column1: But that's exactly what they did by simulating the reaction. And that took two days. So in two days, they created the Moderna vaccine.
column2: M̄-koh，in (Moderna) 就有影按呢做，in 反應 kā 用模擬--ê，而且 kan-ta 用二工。所以，二工內底，in 就 kā Moderna 疫苗創造--出來。

column1: And that is still on the market. It's been the best vaccine, it was done in two days. And we're going to do that with every other thing.
column2: 而且彼支疫苗這馬 iáu-koh tī 市場--neh。彼支是上讚 ê 疫苗, kan-ta 兩工 to̍h 創--好矣。Koh 有，咱欲 tī 萭項物 lóng án-ne 做。

column1: There's some very promising cancer cures that are out there, which AI produced, and they're looking very promising. The next few years is going to be remarkable for medicine.
column2: 有一寡 AI 做--出來 ê 癌藥已經 tī 遐 ，看--起來誠有希望。紲--落來幾若冬，醫藥會有大碼進步。

column1: We had 190,000 proteins done by people in 2022. 2023, AlphaFold 2 did 200 million, basically every protein and how they fold.
column2: 2022 年，人總共研究 19 萬个蛋白質。2023 年，AlphaFold 2 做 2 億个，基本上包括所有遮个蛋白質 kap in 按怎拗疊。

column1: Every protein that's used in humans and every other species on Earth done in a few months. And we're going to be able to go through cures for diseases at the same rate.
column2: 所有人類 kap 地球頂懸其他物種 lóng-chóng 用 ê 蛋白質，幾若個月內底 to̍h 做--煞矣。Koh 來，咱 ē-tàng 照仝速度來揣醫各種病 ê 藥方。

column1: So we're going to simulate trials digitally. It'll be much safer. It'll be a million times faster.
column2: 所以，咱走數位模擬試驗。按呢會 koh 較安全，mā 會較緊百萬倍。

column1: And by the end of this decade, as we go into the 2030s, we're going to achieve a new milestone. It's called longevity escape velocity. Let me say that again, because you're going to be hearing a lot about that.
column2: 到這个十冬尾，咱 to̍h 欲入去 2030 年代，咱會致到一个新 ê 里程碑。叫做長壽走脫速度。我 koh 講一擺，因為你會 koh 聽愈濟這塊詞。長壽走脫速度。

column1: Longevity escape velocity.
column2: 長壽走脫速度。

column1: Right now you go through a year and you use up a year of your longevity. However, scientific progress is also progressing, which is actually bringing us back.
column2: 這馬你過一冬，你 to̍h kā 一冬 ê 歲壽用用--去。是講，科學進步 mā leh 進步，這事實上 kā 咱 koh khiú(搝)--轉來。

column1: It's giving us cures for diseases, new forms of treatment. So right now you're getting back about four months.
column2: 伊 hō͘ 咱有醫病 ê 藥仔，kap 新 ê 治療處方。這馬，你每一冬大約 ē-tàng khiú(搝)轉來四個月。

column1: So you lose a year, you get back four months, so you're losing eight months. However, the scientific progress is on an exponential. It's going to get faster and faster.
column2: 所以，你 phàng-kiàn(拍毋見)一冬，討轉來四個月，你 to̍h 無去八个月。m̄-koh，科學進步是按指數成長，會愈來愈緊。

column1: And as we get to the early 2030s, let's say between 2029 and 2035, depending on how diligent you are, you're going to get back a full year.
column2: 聽候 2030 年代初，咱講 2029 年到 2035 年這站仔，看你有偌拍拼，你是有法度 kā 規冬討--轉來。

column1: So you lose a year, you get back a year. As we actually go past that point, you'll actually get back more than a year and you'll go backwards in time, which would be cool.
column2: 所以，你一冬無--去，koh 提--轉來一冬 。咱有影 hāⁿ(迒) 過彼个點 ê 時，你 ē-tàng 提轉來 khah 濟一冬，你就會時間倒退 lu，按呢 to̍h siak-phāⁿ(鑠奅)--ah。 (笑聲)

column1: Now some people are concerned we’re going to run out of resources. And actually, if we just went ahead and didn't make any new resources, we would run out of resources like energy, for example.
column2: 這馬，有一寡人煩惱講，資源會用了--去。事實上，若準講咱直直 án-ne 行，無去製造新 ê 資源，資源 to̍h 會用--煞，譬論講能源。

column1: But this is not happening in a vacuum. AI is revolutionizing everything. For example, we only have to connect one part in 10,000 of the sunlight that falls on the Earth to meet all of our energy needs.
column2: M̄-koh，這毋是 tī 真空(啥物攏無) 內底發生 ê 代誌。AI tng leh kā 一切革命。譬論，咱 kan-ta kā iā(掖) tī 地球頂懸 ê 日頭光 1 萬分之一 sîn(承)--起來，to̍h 會當滿足咱所有 ê 能源需求。

column1: It's plenty of headroom and that's growing exponentially and will achieve that within ten years.
column2: 成長空間 koh 誠 chē，而且 án-ne ê 科技 tī leh 指數成長，十冬內底就會達成。

column1: So ... We will have plenty of resources. And when we get to the 2030s, nanobots will connect our brains to the cloud just the way your phone does.
column2: 所以…咱會有濟濟資源。聽候 2030 年代，Nano 機器人會 kā 咱 ê 頭殼 kap 雲頂相連--起來，就 chhan-chhiūⁿ(親像) 恁 ê 電話做--ê。

column1: It'll expand intelligence a million-fold by 2045. That is the singularity.
column2: 到 2045 年，智力會擴張百萬倍。這就是奇點。

column1: We will be funnier. (Laughter) Sexier, smarter, more creative, free from biological limitations.
column2: 咱會 khah 心適。(笑聲) khah 性感、khah 巧、khah 有創意，袂 koh hō͘ 生物 ê 限制縛牢--leh。

column1: We'll be able to choose our appearance. We'll be able to do things we can't do today, like visualize objects in 11 dimensions.
column2: 咱 ē-tàng 揀咱欲活做啥款。咱 ē-tàng 做這馬無法度做 ê 代誌，袂輸佇 11 次元--ni̍h 看物件。

column1: We can speak all languages. We'll be able to expand consciousness in ways we can barely imagine.
column2: 咱 ē-tàng 講所有語言。咱 ē-tàng 用咱這馬無法度想像 ê 方式來 kā 意識擴張。

column1: We will experience richer culture with our extra years.
column2: 咱會用咱加--出來 ê 歲壽來體驗 khah 豐沛 ê 文化。

column1: So I've recently become a grandfather I'm very much looking forward to that, spending more time with family, friends, loving and being loved, all enhanced by AI.
column2: 我這站仔才做阿公，我有影向望這層代誌，有 thang 開較濟時間 chham 家族、朋友，我愛--ê kap 愛--我 ê，in mā lóng hō͘ AI 提升有io̍h。

column1: I believe this gives life its greatest meaning. Thank you very much. (Applause)
column2: 我相信這 hō͘ 我人生上大 ê 意義。足多謝逐家。( pho̍k-á 聲)
